column4: I just ran the following commands in the terminal and here are the results, sure could use a guru about now  http://paste.ubuntu.com/963422/
Oh, I am running Ubuntu 10.04.4 64bit on a 64 bit Toshiba Laptop A355SD Satellite
what specifically do you want to know about that output?
If it tells me why I cannot see the media I inserted into the drive
The disk that is loaded is Ubuntu 10.04 LTS Boot and it cannot be read from the boot startup with the CD being set as the 1st boot device
nope, all i can see is that your /dev/cdrom is a symbolic link to sr0, and you have no printer attached/on and your networkcard started. heh

I want to know if there is info on why i am not seeing any media that I am trying to read or copy, this started 2 days ago when I burned 2 Ubuntu Disks for give away and the second one didn't burn as there was a message "No Media"
there is nothing related to that in the pastebin you posted.
Wylde, do you have any ideas on how I should be trying to troubleshoot this problem?
does your optical drive read other disks correctly?

At present it reads nothing I have tried every disk I can think of and after 3 days of sorting through over a hundred disks with the same "No Media" I am of the mind that the drive is bad but I just bought it on friday and it worked fome
DOA hardware happens sometimes. I'd have to agree that it's most likely the hardware.

wylde,At present it reads nothing I have tried every disk I can think of and after 3 days of sorting through over a hundred disks with the same "No Media" I am of the mind that the drive is bad but I just bought it on friday and it worked fine
I'd blame a faulty drive too. Things like that happen with electronics sometimes. I've seen my share of DOA hardware :)
I live on a little isle, and there is next to nothing here for repair work, the closest place is about 160 miles away and so I was digging so I wouldn't have to take a 12 hour boat ride
I should have said as far as parts go, repairs I have been doing myself since the 50's
sorry to hear that, but from what you describe, it definately sounds like faulty hardware. Although there's lots here to get a second opinion from :)
IaOra Again, Is there an
I thank you immensely for your help,   I was also trying to see if there might be a way to test the unit to see if it were hdwre or softwre causing the prob
other than re-seating cables and whatnot, not much. Possibly seeing if the device has the same issue connected to another machine?

I just pulled it and will take it to our local shade tree mechanic, I use them only for parts or doing translations when I run into a Windoze problem as all the machines here for the most part are French
alrighty.

it worked perfect until I was doing a burn for give aways,  you were great help, and again I more or less was of the same opinion, just yesterday was a waste and it failed over the weekend and nothing works in the South Pacific when it comes to weekends especially those with a holiday and may day was that
it always seems these sorts of things like to happen at most inconvenient times.
